Reviews.Title: “Large, clean, quiet rooms with great staff”
Reviews.Author: sarah7038
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Cooper while visiting family in Dallas (the Lodge was the closest hotel to where my relatives live). I did not use any of the fitness or spa facilities other than the walking trails, which were very peaceful and inviting. The room was large, clean, and very quiet (I did not hear any noise at all). The staff was unfailingly polite and helpful. The only negative was that the decor of the room looked like it was straight out of the 1980's (wallpaper, furniture, bath fixtures, etc). The room was also very dark, so I needed to turn on lights even during the day. If the Cooper Lodge updates their rooms, this could really become a fabulous destination.

Reviews.Title: “More a clinic than a spa. For weekend pamper stay go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: TeresaCLondon
Reviews.Content: I booked in by myself for a spa weekend. I didn't book any programme or anything like that. It was a bad start: I found reception and was given my key. I wasn't told anything else: I.e. where is my room, where is the fitness centre, spa, breakfast room, restaurant. Obviously I worked it out. My room was large and nicely furnished. Good wifi service, clean, comfortable. The place looks like a campus though and I was thinking more landscaped grounds which was a surprise. So, no view to speak of from the rom, just joggers going round the track! The gym is a short walk and it's massive and well equipped. There is a small ladies sauna and jacuzzi in the changing room. Decent, but nothing more than you'd find in a decent gym. I booked a massage and the therapist, Lindy, was lovely. I recommend her. The let down for me was the dining. I stopped by the "restaurant" for dinner on both nights. It was like someone's living room, moreover empty of people and no tables laid. Very weird. So I got room service which was speedy and good food. Don't expect a wine list though :) it's tee total. Similarly, the breakfast set up was like a cheap motel: tiny glass lean to with a help yourself counter of standard bagels, cornflakes etc. I was expecting fresh cooked healthy fare on a white tablecloth... Overall, it was relaxing but as a spa weekend experience I would opt for one of the fancy hotels next time. It's more of a clinic than pamper place.

Reviews.Title: “Aways a perfect and wonderful experince”
Reviews.Author: jon g
Reviews.Content: I love staying at the cooper center. the staff is wonderful, it is not only relaxing but the gym is top notch. every detail is taken care of and the entire structure works as a unit. I have given several meetings here and I am thrilled with each and every experince.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay for a conference”
Reviews.Author: TravelDelaware
Reviews.Content: The rooms, service and setting were perfect. If you need to "escape" as part of your retreat, this is a great place to get refocused. The rooms were outstanding, clean and plush. Having a five star fitness center as part of the complex was a really nice benefit. And I can't say enough about the hospitality of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Week”
Reviews.Author: Jody N
Reviews.Content: I just spent a life changing week at the Cooper Wellness Program. The facilities of the lodge were beautiful. Great, spacious room. Wonderful amenities, like towels, Aveda products, free wi-fi.Staff who is always willing to go above and beyond the call of duty to please. I wouldn't change a thing!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: marilyn p
Reviews.Content: The Cooper Guest Lodge Hotel is a perfect place with beautiful grounds, a fitness walking trail, pool, fitness center and delicious dining. It is a peasceful and comfortable oasis in the midst of Dallas. Staff is extremely accomodating and everyone including guests are delightfully welcoming and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Bride_of_the_Groom
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful environment to stay in. The front dest associates were very helpful. And the housekeeping crew was exceptional. Loved the fact that in the evening my bed was made up with the blankets folded over ready for me to go to bed. The only update I would include would be refrigerators in the rooms; although I was able to keep my leftovers with the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Dallas' best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: LSDtravels
Reviews.Content: My expectations were more than met during my stay at the Cooper Guest Lodge. It's a quiet resort-style hotel, with all the amenities for the business traveler on the go. Besides the spacious rooms and delicious meal offerings, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The biggest perk of all was having access to their fitness center. Picture a high end gym, with complimentary access to all group fitness classes. With their cycling class, I didn't even get out of my daily workout routine. Cooper is a must stay in my books.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful walking/running trails”
Reviews.Author: deniselagrange5
Reviews.Content: As we arrived in the evening, I had no idea how beautiful the grounds of the lodge were. The walking/running trails are so nice in going back and forth between the nice oak trees and around the Cooper Clinic buildings. The tennis courts were full with smiling people playinig lively rounds of tennis. The fitness areas are state of the art and staffed by friendly and helpful staff. There were several outdoor pools which appeared to be heated as it was November and they were full of swimmers doing laps. As we were upgraded to a suite, we had a large bedroom, large bathroom as well as a living room, dining table and bar area. We enjoyed the extra space but the allure of this hotel is the surroundings. The location is great, just off 635 and near many good restaurants such as Mercury as well as the Galleria.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice surprise..”
Reviews.Author: Will E
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Cooper Aerobics Center was organised for me by the Dallas based company I was visiting. They had heard I enjoyed running etc. Lovely spacious rooms, amazingly comfortable bed, very quiet (no door banging or noisy late night drinkers) and fabulous fitness facilities. The previous review was spot on - its like being on a very smart university campus. Lots of interesting history too. The staff were REALLY friendly and couldn't do enough. I will certainly return if I come back to Dallas

Reviews.Title: “Good excercise facility, a little tired looking”
Reviews.Author: cupcake3
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was off to a good start when I was upgraded to a very large suite named for a famous Texas figure. I had a hallway, bar, living room and bedroom. Extremely spacious! I thought while it was nice, it had some deferred maintenance, such as the rose colored carpet faded in spots and needed to be replaced. The bathroom, while large and nice, needed to be updated because it screamed "1980" to me. On the weekday, there was a free continetal breakfast, but the room was in horrible condition, not at all nice. I ate in the almost empty dining room which aslo needed to be updated, because it looked very 1975 to me. The food was just OK. The ground are lovely and a very large campus. The buildings looked like they needed to be repainted about 3 years ago. The excercise facility was nice, but also a little old looking. I belong to "The Houstonian" in Houston, ( the first Prez Bush is a member) and it is the workout facility at Cooper was not nearly as nice as The Houstonian. Tip: If you did not bring your laptop, they have a free computer with internet access for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a find!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller R
Reviews.Content: I attended a small meeting at this place, which I had only briefly heard of as more of a fitness center. The grounds made me feel if I had stepped back onto a small, private university. Very well kept grounds, friendly staff (love that Texas hospitality!), and a casual atmosphere. The campus itself is huge, but the staff is warm and welcoming. Free wireless internet, cable TV, huge rooms - bed was a bit too firm for me - and gorgeous bathrooms. For business travelers they have the free wireless, a business center, complimentary continental breakfast. Nice pool area for families and children. I was there during "summer youth camp" and was expected to find kids all over the place, but not true - they were all at the pool during the day but otherwise not seen. A great property for everyone, and nearby to other restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: attorneymoore
Reviews.Content: My wife and I evacuated ourselves and my mother in anticipation of Hurricane Rita. This was the last lodging in Dallas with 5 continuous days vacancy. I did not know if we were going to the No_Tel Motel. My wife called me upon arrival to say that it was the most luxurious fat farm she had ever seen. Beautiful rooms, free WiFi, HUGE olympic lap pool, gorgeous workout gym with individual LCD screens on each treadmill, and restaurants where you do not have to go through an elaborate cross-examination of the waiter to keep the extra butter off the entre. Expect a well-manicured campus typical of a small Southern Baptist college. There is a Whole Foods store down the street with more young woman who have had cosmetic surgery than we have ever seen in Houston.

HotelInfo.Name: Cooper Guest Lodge Hotel, Conference Center & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 12230 Preston Road, Dallas, TX 75230
